text: Leila Seth (October 20, 1930 - May 5, 2016) was an Indian judge. She was the first woman judge on the Delhi High Court and she became the first woman to become Chief Justice of a state High Court on August 5, 1991. She retired from the court on October 20, 1992. Seth was born in Lucknow, British India. Seth died on May 5, 2017 at her home in Noida, India from cardio-respiratory arrest at the age of 86.Leila Seth, first woman judge of Delhi High Court, dies ==Notes== *Seth, Leila. On Balance. New Delhi: Viking, 2003. *Seth, Vikram. Two Lives. HarperCollins, 2005. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Indian judges Category:People from Uttar Pradesh
title: Leila Seth
